title: Is firefox controlled by hateful racist now?
content: Recently my AdBlocker extension in Firefox was disabled. At first I thought it was just a bug, but after I closed and restarted Firefox, it was still disabled, installing various other ad blocking extensions was thwarted by Firefox. I tried other approaches, including installing from github and from third party extension library; all are unsuccessful. Apparently, Firefox do not allow Chinese users to use ad blocking extensions, and they went to great lengths to stop them. You hateful racist scums! Firefox was once very popular, but now its share of the browser market shrink to almost 0%. I see why now, I hope Firefox die a quick demise, and nobody remembers it thereafter.

title: passwords gone
content:
After usual PC restart non of my logins work anymore. I have logins.json file and key4 db file in my profile but firefox does not want to read them anymore. In json file I can see all the website and encrypted passwords, so all looks good there. Even more interesting, if I create new password it is saved in the same logins.json file but I can see those in the browser. So out of 50 logins there I can see only most recent two.

I tried to uninstall and reinstall mozilla and then copy logins.json and key4 files to the new profile but it did not help. Any ideas appreciated.

title: Concern Regarding Slow Extension Review Process
content:
Dear Firefox Add-ons Team,

I hope this email finds you well.

We have noticed that the review process for Firefox extensions is significantly slower compared to other browsers. For instance, Chrome and Edge typically complete their review within two hours, whereas Firefox takes considerably longer.

When issues arise with our extension, we need to release an updated version as soon as possible. Sometimes, these situations are urgent, and the prolonged review time makes it difficult to provide users with the latest fixes and improvements promptly. This delay negatively impacts the user experience.

We kindly request that you consider optimizing the review process to help developers deliver timely updates and ensure a smoother experience for Firefox users.

Thank you for your time and support. We appreciate your efforts in maintaining the Firefox ecosystem.

Best regards, Coupert Development Team
